Interface ICollectionManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:

    public interface ICollectionManager
    The interface for the collectionmanager. It provides all usefull methods.

      • putNewCollection

        boolean putNewCollection(Collection coll,
                       org.bukkit.Location baseloc)
        The method to add a new collection. The manger does not take care of any money handling, or anything else like that. All it does it is add it to the list. All collections gets a 3x3 area registered to them on creation, based on the location provided. If this 3x3 area is already claimed by another collection, the collection won't be added and the method will return false.
        Parameters:
        coll - The collection to add.
        baseloc - The center for the 3x3 area that will be claimed for that collection. The y axis doesn't matter.
        Returns:
        True if the collection was added, false otherwise.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getWorldMap

        IWorldMap getWorldMap()
        Used to get the WorldMap interface. The world map can be used in order to check if some rows are already claimed by other collections/plots.
        Returns:
        The WorldMap interface, containing all useful commands.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getCurrentCollection

        Collection getCurrentCollection(String player)
        Use this to get the current collection the specified player is standing in.
        Parameters:
        player - The name of the player you wan't to get info on.
        Returns:
        The collection if the player is inside one. Null if he isn't.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getCollection

        Collection getCollection(UUID uuid)
        Use this to get a collection based on its UUID.
        Parameters:
        uuid - The UUID of the collection you are requesting.
        Returns:
        The collection with the UUID specified. Null if that collection doesn't exists.
        Since:
        1.0.0
